item.title: Moving the cursor point in word
item.description: The text you type appears wherever the insertion/cursor point is positioned in the current document. Moving the insertion point around the screen is a critical part of creating and editing documents. To move the insertion point around the screen, you can use either the keyboard or the mouse. Table 1-1 lists ways to move the insertion point by using keystrokes. https://www.trainingconnection.com/word/lessons/moving-cursor.php Keystroke Result Up, Down, Left, or Right Arrow Moves the insertion point to the previous or next line or character.
